etymology.description: 肉(肉) (ròu, "meat") + 犬(犬) (quǎn, "dog") = meat and dog together -> used as phonetic component in 然(然) (rán, "so")
etymology.interpretation: The character 肰(rán) combines 肉(肉) (ròu, "meat") and 犬(犬) (quǎn, "dog") to represent meat associated with a dog, perhaps symbolizing the complexities of early human-dog relationships or consumption patterns. It primarily functions as a phonetic component in the character 然(然) (rán, "so").

examples.chinese: 学者研究古汉字(學者研究古漢字)，发现‘然’结构中包含肰(發現‘然’結構中包含肰)。
examples.pinyin: xuézhě yánjiū gǔ hànzì, fāxiàn 'rán' jiégòu zhōng bāohán rán.
examples.english: Scholars study ancient Chinese characters, discovering that the structure of 'rán' contains its phonetic component.

examples.chinese: 肰是‘然’的形旁构件(肰是‘然’的形旁構件)。
examples.english: 'rán' is the phonetic radical component in 'rán'.

examples.chinese: 宋代字典中记载‘然’含肰表音(宋代字典中記載‘然’含肰表音)，显其声旁作用(顯其聲旁作用)。
examples.pinyin: sòngdài zìdiǎn zhōng jìzǎi 'rán' hán rán biǎoyīn, xiǎn qí shēngpáng zuòyòng.
examples.english: A Song dynasty dictionary records that 'rán' includes the phonetic element rán, demonstrating its role as a sound indicator.
